job_title: Anonymous Employee in Jamaica, NY
pros: was ableb to get hired during tne pandemic the paid was good the household size was perfect to cook for. my schedule was fantastic.
cons: Extra worK not only you cook ,buy food for the residents you have to go to the main office and pick up 9 supermart gift cards 6 from one 3 from the other main office is across town . Also group couseling and you have a one on one resident that you are assign today and have to meet with every day. But here's the b.s I was let go because sometime came up in a background check and was told that I have to call the state myself for an investiagation. so I did I was told nothing came up and the HRdepartment recevied the same results i got. my job told me i have 30 days to get this resolved everyone know that the state takes there time. I told the hr rep why I'm being punshed for your screw up there's nothing in bad in my background check. hr told me i can reaply for my old postion after this matter was resolved. I told her I'm not coming back .I don't go backawards. What a waste of time.

review_title: I have truly enjoyed this job
job_title: Peer Respite Worker in Queens Village, NY
pros: My co-workers are amazing. I truly love going to work. It has been a very positive experience.  I enjoy connecting with the guests, having the privilege of hearing their untold stories, spending each day talking about what is important in life, and what is not such as the best series on Netflix. I have met so many incredible people. The Director and Assistant Director during my time here have been very supportive and encouraging. The CEO of the company is extremely involved and available to talk. He is definitely there for the right reasons. He wants to make a difference. I have loved working here.
cons:
The respite is contracted with a few hospitals. They own beds at the respite and can refer whoever they want. Many who are not appropriate for respite. It endangers the guest themselves, the other guests at the respite, and staff. When these concerns are brought up to management, it is brushed off because the hospitals "pay for the beds." It is not fair to anyone in the respite. 

Additionally, I feel like there are a list of rules to the respite, however, they are not all followed. Some days they stand, other days they do not. Management picks and chooses when they want to follow them to best suit their needs.

job_title: Residential Counselor in New York, NY
pros: Good co-worker, great company values

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Convenient location. Great job security  if your are incompetent lazy irresponsible an active drug addict or suffer from a serious personality disorder  this is the place for you. You will always have a job at least until they  close
cons:
The below comments are my opinion which are based on the events that I observed during my employment 


Lack of  competent  supervision for both students and staff   Some oif the most unprofessional behavior that I have encountered in my  career  such as active substance abuse among staff. Medicaid fraud  ie providing services that are not medically necessary mishandling of high risk   ongoing employee theft  of services as well as abuse of clients.
